snippet: The candidate, Karen Turner, placed second in the three-way race.
abstract: Montclair, NJ, voters elect real estate developer Robert Jackson as mayor, rejecting candidate Karen Turner, who had put forth a platform of reduced spending in a campaign that largely reflected the national debate over spending. (M)d
lead_paragraph: MONTCLAIR, N.J. -- Voters in this historically liberal town rejected on Tuesday a mayoral candidate who had campaigned on a platform of reducing spending and debt and freezing taxes. The candidate, Karen Turner, placed second in the three-way race. Robert Jackson, a real estate developer, won, with his slate sweeping all but one of the six council seats that were also at stake.

headline.main: Montclair Rejects Candidate Seeking to Reduce Spending
